content: stockinette scrunchies scrunchies are making their well-deserved comeback this is simple pattern that s fairly beginner-friendly if you can knit knit in the round and seam you ve got this this pattern uses plain stockinette as the name suggests but using this as a recipe you can experiment with other stitch patterns pretty easily enjoy materials - 30 grams dk weight yarn pictured patons silk bamboo - us 4 3 5 mm 16 circular needle - stitch marker - hair elastic of your choosing - tapestry needle gauge 24 st x 28 row 4 x 4 1 cast on 85 stitches* and join in the round taking care to not twist your stitches place stitch marker to mark beginning of the round 2 knit plain stockinette for 20 row or until 3 from the cast-on edge if you d prefer a less bulky scrunchie knit less this is also where you can experiment with different stitches for the body of your scrunchie just be sure to check your gauge 3 bind off taking care not to bind off too tightly leave a long enough tail for seaming 4 place hair elastic on the wrong side of the fabric seam scrunchy together around the elastic with right side facing out my recommended stitch for seaming these together is mattress stitch it blends and hides the seams well as you seam scrunch the fabric as you go to make room to continue seaming the edges and watch your scrunchie take shape weave in ends *regarding the amount for casting on it all depends on your hair tie the hair ties i use stretch to 7 inches and 85 stitches accommodates it perfectly that s about 12 st per inch when it s fully stretched cast on accordingly resources mattress stitch https //www youtube com/watch v=obuzwhlmdci a great and clear video on the seam used in this pattern
